titleStmt.title: Computational Methods of the Humanities Term Project: Portu-WhatsApp
titleStmt.author: American students of Portuguese at the University of Pittsburgh
Brazilian students of English
titleStmt.principal: Zachary Enick, Brandon Rodgers, Patrick Murray, Tyler Botak

sourceDesc.p: Born digitlal; no previous source exists.

abstract.p: We are analyzing interactions between American students of Portuguese and Brazilian Portuguese L1 speakers via a communication application. Conversations will be tracked for texting conventions such as punctuation, emoji use, and abbreviations. Errors made by the Portuguese learners will also be tracked in addition to corrections, whether explicit or implicit, made by the native Brazilian students.

textDesc.channel: Informal conversation via a cellular messaging application.
textDesc.constitution: Each utterance represents a transcribed text message from a pair's written conversation in Portuguese.

editorialDecl.p: Students' spelling, grammar, and punctuation has been retained.
